mdRecord.dcterms:description: The original plans for Mount Auburn included a chapel that would function as a venue for funeral services. The trustees wanted a design that was consistent with the Romantic Picturesque style used throughout the Cemetery. Several architects submitted design entries, but Jacob Bigelow, one of the Cemetery’s founders, possessed the winning plans. Construction began in 1844. While many of the designs were similar in scale and style, Bigelow’s was the only one to include stained glass. The Chapel was rebuilt in the 1850s of Quincy granite. -- https://mountauburn.org/bigelow-chapel/ [work]
